mdRecord.dcterms:description: This letter is typed on letterhead stationery for Lexington High School. Harrington Waddell, Clerk of Lexington School Board, writes to Francis D. Washington, President of Home and School League, to report that the School Board "has carefully read and considered your communication and made investgation in regard to the matters referred to in it. The board has requested Supt. Irby to investigate the curriculum of the colored school . . ."
mdRecord.dcterms:title: H. Waddell to F. D. Washington, May 10, 1923 (correspondence)
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: African Americans -- Education
